title: UMass ordered to lift suspension for student who organized pro-Palestinian protest
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: UMass Amherst was ordered to lift the suspension of Junior Kivlighan de Montebello after a Superior Court ruling.
Montebello, a student protester, was suspended after leading a demonstration against RTX during a career fair in 2025.
The court ruled UMass likely violated Montebello's First Amendment rights, barring further sanctions while the case continues.

title: Hanover police officer charged with motor vehicle homicide in fatal Brockton hit-and-run
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Hanover officer Thomas Hayes, 36, charged with motor vehicle homicide in fatal Brockton hit-and-run.
Hayes allegedly hit Alfredo Alves, 23, while driving; friend reported the incident after noticing vehicle damage.
Hayes, on leave, posted $10,000 bail but remains held; hearing set for March 31 in Brockton District Court.

title: Choosing a product that fixes foggy headlights
author: John Paul
bullets: John Paul from AAA Northeast advises using Meguiar’s Keep Clear Headlight Coating to prevent re-fogging of headlight covers for up to a year.
A 2019 VW Jetta owner experienced an oil pressure regulator valve failure but was not covered under VW's warranty extension for this issue.
A 2015 Honda Accord owner reports ongoing starter issues; potential causes include aftermarket starter defects or damaged flywheel gear.

title: Man arrested in Fenway on child rape, human trafficking charges
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Talik Rashaun Garcia, 36, was arrested in Fenway on charges of child rape and human trafficking, Boston police announced.
Garcia faces multiple charges, including child exploitation, dissemination of illicit materials, and trafficking underage persons for sexual servitude.
He pleaded not guilty, was released on $5,000 cash bail, and must avoid contact with the alleged victim; state police assisted the arrest.

title: Man charged with motor vehicle homicide in Pittsfield hit and run that saw victim dragged 4 miles, DA says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: William Gross, 65, was charged with motor vehicle homicide in a hit-and-run killing William Colbert, 69, in Pittsfield.
Colbert was struck at the Linden Street/Francis Avenue intersection and dragged four miles to a hotel where he was found dead.
Gross was arrested after an extensive investigation and is scheduled for arraignment Wednesday in Central Berkshire District Court.

title: Mass. RMV lottery opens for 250th anniversary license plates. Here’s how to apply.
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: The Massachusetts RMV is holding a lottery for low-number MA250 anniversary license plates celebrating the state's 250th year.
Massachusetts residents can apply online for the lottery until April 17, 2026; no fee is required to enter.
Winners will be announced in May and must pay $60 registration and $40 specialty plate fees for the commemorative plates.

title: Massachusetts becomes first state to use ChatGPT in the executive branch, drawing criticism
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Massachusetts is the first state to introduce an AI assistant, ChatGPT, for its 40,000 executive branch employees.
The AI tool will be gradually implemented starting with the Executive Office of Technology Services and Security.
The National Association of Government Employees criticized the rollout, fearing AI could impact job duties and data security.

title: Close to 100 jobs lost as 2 Massachusetts packaging plants shut down
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Garlock Flexibles will shut down two facilities in Gardner, Massachusetts, by September, laying off 91 employees.
The packaging company, acquired by Astara Capital Partners in 2021, specializes in packaging solutions for food, snacks, and produce.
Garlock Flexibles rebranded in 2023, paying homage to its founder, and has expanded operations to Reno, Nevada, since 2013.

title: Assailant in Pawtucket hockey rink shooting killed ex-wife and son, police confirm
author: Abby Patkin and Molly Farrar
bullets: Robert Dorgan killed his ex-wife Rhonda and son Aidan Dorgan at a Pawtucket hockey game, police confirmed.
Three others, including Rhonda's parents, were critically injured in the shooting at Dennis M. Lynch Arena.
The incident is under investigation; Dorgan legally owned the guns used in the shooting and then shot himself.

title: Boston’s Vietnamese community celebrates Tết with culture and tradition
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Boston's Vietnamese community celebrated Tết with cultural festivities at Menino Convention & Exhibition Center in South Boston.
The festival, organized by the Vietnamese American Community of Massachusetts, featured traditional art, food, and cultural performances.
The event attracted diverse attendees, emphasizing cultural connections and community engagement among Vietnamese Americans and others.
